document.discussion_title: Indonesia's Aneka Gas Industri Targets $75m in IPO
document.topic_text: INDEX Indonesia's Aneka Gas Industri Targets $75m in IPO i This file photo taken on Oct 2, 2015 shows Pertamina EP's gas collecting facilities in Subang, West Java. Aneka Gas Industri buys the gas from facilities like this and distributes them across Indonesia. (Antara Photo/Andika Wahyu) By : Fransiska Nangoy | on 1:42 PM August 22, 2016 Category : Business , Corporate News Jakarta. Indonesian gas producer Aneka Gas Industri set its initial public offering price range at Rp 1,000 to Rp 1,290 per share, the company's president director, Heyzer Harsono, said on Monday (22/08). The company plans to sell as many as 766.7 million shares, according to a prospectus published on Monday. At the top of the range the company may raise Rp 989 billion ($75 million). Aneka Gas is one of the country largest industrial gas distributor and it is controlled by Harsono family's Samator Group. The company supplies gasses like oxygen, nitrogen and helium as well as fuel like liquefied petroleum gas to manufacturers and medical facilities across the country. Reuters
